code: @Manual{,   title = {bballref: Web Scraping Tools for Basketball Reference},   author = {{Eliseo}},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://eliseogarilleti.github.io/bballref/}, }

what: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: R package scraping NBA statistics Basketball Reference bballref R package provides easy access NBA basketball statistics Basketball Reference. Extract player stats, team stats, league averages, historical championship data simple, intuitive functions.

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("EliseoGarilleti/bballref")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Player Statistics: Per game, totals, per 36 minutes, per 100 possessions, advanced stats, shooting stats, play--play stats Team Statistics: Season--season stats aggregate historical stats League Statistics: Historical NBA league averages Championship Data: Complete NBA championship history Automatic Data Cleaning: Handles complex column names (e.g., 3P% → three_Ppct) Season Type Support: Regular season playoff statistics Player Name Search: Use player names Basketball Reference IDs

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
code: library(bballref)  # Get LeBron James' per game stats (all seasons) lebron <- player_per_game("LeBron James")  # Get Lakers 2020 regular season stats lakers <- team_per_game("LAL", 2020)  # Get NBA champions from 2010 to 2020 champs <- champions(first_year = 2010, last_year = 2020)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: player functions accept either player name (e.g., “LeBron James”) Basketball Reference player ID (e.g., “jamesle01”). also support season_type parameter: "regular" (default) "playoffs".

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get per game statistics player across seasons. Example: Returns: Dataframe columns like Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, three_P, three_PA, FGpct, etc.
code: # Using player name lebron_pg <- player_per_game("LeBron James")  # Get playoff stats lebron_playoffs <- player_per_game("LeBron James", "playoffs")  # Using player ID curry_pg <- player_per_game("curryst01")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get season totals player across seasons. Example: Returns: Similar columns per game, showing cumulative season totals instead averages.
code: durant_totals <- player_totals("Kevin Durant") durant_playoff_totals <- player_totals("Kevin Durant", "playoffs")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get per 36 minutes statistics player. Example: Returns: Stats normalized per 36 minutes played.
code: giannis_per36 <- player_per_minute("Giannis Antetokounmpo")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get per 100 possessions statistics player. Example: Returns: Stats normalized per 100 team possessions.
code: jokic_per_poss <- player_per_poss("Nikola Jokic")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get advanced statistics player (PER, TS%, USG%, etc.). Example: Returns: Advanced metrics including PER, True Shooting %, Usage Rate, Win Shares, BPM, VORP, etc.
code: embiid_advanced <- player_advanced("Joel Embiid")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get shooting statistics distance zone. Example: Returns: Shot distribution, field goal percentages distance, corner 3s, etc.
code: curry_shooting <- player_shooting("Stephen Curry")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get play--play statistics (shooting fouls, -1s, etc.). Example: Returns: Play--play events frequencies.
code: harden_pbp <- player_pbp("James Harden")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: team functions require team code (3-letter abbreviation like “LAL”, “BOS”, “GSW”) year. support season_type: "regular" (default) "playoffs".

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get per game statistics team specific season. Example: Returns: Player--player stats team roster season.
code: # Lakers 2020 regular season lakers_2020 <- team_per_game("LAL", 2020)  # Warriors 2022 playoffs warriors_playoffs <- team_per_game("GSW", 2022, "playoffs")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get season totals team. Example: Returns: Cumulative season totals player roster.
code: celtics_totals <- team_totals("BOS", 2024)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get per 36 minutes statistics team. Example:
code: heat_per36 <- team_per_minute("MIA", 2023)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get per 100 possessions statistics team. Example:
code: nuggets_per_poss <- team_per_poss("DEN", 2023)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get advanced statistics team. Example: Returns: Advanced metrics like TS%, eFG%, ORB%, DRB%, AST%, etc.
code: bucks_advanced <- team_advanced("MIL", 2021)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get shooting statistics distance team. Example:
code: warriors_shooting <- team_shooting("GSW", 2022)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get play--play statistics team. Example:
code: lakers_pbp <- team_pbp("LAL", 2020)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get roster information team. Example: Returns: Player names, positions, height, weight, birth date, college, etc.
code: celtics_roster <- team_roster("BOS", 2024)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get aggregate total statistics team across seasons franchise history. Example: Returns: Season--season totals wins, losses, points, shooting percentages, etc., spanning entire franchise history.
code: # Get all-time totals for Atlanta Hawks hawks_totals <- team_stats_totals("ATL")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get aggregate per game statistics team across seasons franchise history. Example: Returns: Season--season per game averages spanning entire franchise history.
code: # Get all-time per game averages for Lakers lakers_pg <- team_stats_per_game("LAL")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: League functions provide NBA-wide averages across seasons. support season_type: "regular" (default) "playoffs".

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get historical NBA league per game averages. Example: Returns: League-wide averages season (pace, PPG, FG%, 3PA, etc.).
code: # Regular season league averages league_avg <- league_per_game()  # Playoff league averages league_playoffs <- league_per_game("playoffs")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get historical NBA league totals. Example: Returns: League-wide cumulative totals season.
code: league_totals_data <- league_totals()

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get historical NBA league per 100 possessions stats. Example: Returns: League-wide stats normalized per 100 possessions.
code: league_per_poss_data <- league_per_poss()

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Get NBA championship history automatic year validation. Example: Returns: Dataframe columns Year, Champion (team name), team (3-letter code), plus additional championship details.
code: # All available champions all_champs <- champions()  # Champions from 1980 to 2000 champs_80s_90s <- champions(first_year = 1980, last_year = 2000)  # Champions from 2010 onwards recent_champs <- champions(first_year = 2010)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Full list available Basketball Reference

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: package automatically cleans column names easier data manipulation: 3P → three_P 3PA → three_PA 3P% → three_Ppct 2P → two_P FG% → FGpct : : makes easy work data R:
code: # Column names from Basketball Reference c("Player", "Age", "3P", "3PA", "3P%", "FG%") # Cleaned column names in bballref c("Player", "Age", "three_P", "three_PA", "three_Ppct", "FGpct") lebron <- player_per_game("LeBron James")  # No syntax errors! lebron$three_Ppct  # Works perfectly

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Functions provide informative console messages:
code: player_per_game("LeBron James") # Searching player: LeBron James # Success: 22 rows obtained  team_per_game("LAL", 2020) # Searching team: LAL 2020 (regular season) # Success: 18 rows obtained  champions(first_year = 2015, last_year = 2020) # Obteniendo campeones de NBA... #   -> Años disponibles: 1947 - 2025 #   -> Éxito: 6 campeones obtenidos ( 2015 - 2020 )

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
text: Rate Limiting: package includes automatic 2-second delays requests respect Basketball Reference’s servers Case Insensitive: Player names case-insensitive: "lebron james" works "LeBron James" Player IDs: can find player IDs Basketball Reference URLs (e.g., /players/j/jamesle01.html → "jamesle01") Data Types: data returned character type maximum compatibility. Convert numeric needed:
code: lebron$PTS <- as.numeric(lebron$PTS)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
code: library(bballref) library(dplyr)  # Get career stats lebron <- player_per_game("LeBron James") jordan <- player_per_game("Michael Jordan")  # Compare career PPG mean(as.numeric(lebron$PTS), na.rm = TRUE) mean(as.numeric(jordan$PTS), na.rm = TRUE)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
code: # Get Lakers 2020 championship roster and stats lakers_roster <- team_roster("LAL", 2020) lakers_stats <- team_per_game("LAL", 2020) lakers_playoffs <- team_per_game("LAL", 2020, "playoffs")  # Top scorers in playoffs lakers_playoffs %>%   mutate(PTS = as.numeric(PTS)) %>%   arrange(desc(PTS)) %>%   select(Player, PTS, AST, TRB) %>%   head(5)

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference
code: library(ggplot2)  # Get historical league averages league_data <- league_per_game()  # Plot 3-point shooting evolution league_data %>%   mutate(Season = as.numeric(substr(Season, 1, 4)),          three_PA = as.numeric(three_PA)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Season, y = three_PA)) +   geom_line() +   labs(title = "NBA 3-Point Attempts Per Game Over Time",        x = "Season", y = "3PA per game")

title: bballref: NBA Statistics from Basketball Reference

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: document demonstrates functions available bballref package examples sample output.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get per game statistics player across seasons. Total seasons: 23
code: # Get LeBron James per game stats lebron_pg <- player_per_game("LeBron James") ## Searching player: LeBron James ## Success: 23 rows obtained # Show first 10 seasons head(lebron_pg, 10) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, FGpct) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get season totals player. Total seasons: 17
code: # Get Stephen Curry totals curry_totals <- player_totals("Stephen Curry") ## Searching player: Stephen Curry ## Success: 17 rows obtained # Show first 10 seasons head(curry_totals, 10) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, three_P) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

text: Get per 36 minutes statistics. Total seasons: 13
code: # Get Giannis per 36 stats giannis_per36 <- player_per_minute("Giannis Antetokounmpo") ## Searching player: Giannis Antetokounmpo ## Success: 13 rows obtained # Show first 8 seasons head(giannis_per36, 8) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get advanced statistics (PER, TS%, WS, etc.). Total seasons: 21
code: # Get Kevin Durant advanced stats durant_adv <- player_advanced("Kevin Durant") ## Searching player: Kevin Durant ## Success: 21 rows obtained # Show first 8 seasons head(durant_adv, 8) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, PER, WS, BPM) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get per 100 possessions statistics. Total seasons:
code: # Get Nikola Jokic per 100 poss stats jokic_poss <- player_per_poss("Nikola Jokic") ## Error: Player not found - Nikola Jokic # Show all seasons jokic_poss %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB) %>%   kable() ## Error in UseMethod("select"): no applicable method for 'select' applied to an object of class "NULL"

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get shooting statistics distance zone. Total seasons: 17
code: # Get Stephen Curry shooting stats curry_shoot <- player_shooting("Stephen Curry") ## Searching player: Stephen Curry ## Success: 17 rows obtained # Show recent 5 seasons head(curry_shoot, 5) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, FGpct, three_Ppct) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get play--play statistics. Total seasons: 21
code: # Get James Harden pbp stats harden_pbp <- player_pbp("James Harden") ## Searching player: James Harden ## Success: 21 rows obtained # Show recent 5 seasons head(harden_pbp, 5) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get career statistics multiple players . Total rows: 42 Players: 2
code: # Compare LeBron and Jordan goats <- player_stats_bulk(   stat_function = player_per_game,   players = c("LeBron James", "Michael Jordan"),   season_type = "regular",   progress = FALSE ) ## Fetching data for 2 players... ## Searching player: LeBron James ## Success: 23 rows obtained ## Searching player: Michael Jordan ## Success: 19 rows obtained ## Success: Combined 42 rows from 2 players # Show first 5 seasons for each goats %>%   group_by(player_id) %>%   slice(1:5) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, player_id) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get per game statistics team specific season. Total players: 21
code: # Get Lakers 2020 per game stats lakers_2020 <- team_per_game("LAL", 2020) ## Searching team: LAL 2020 (regular season) ## Success: 21 rows obtained # Show all players lakers_2020 %>%   select(Player, Age, G, PTS, AST, TRB) %>%   kable()

text: Get play--play statistics team. Total players: 21
code: # Get Lakers 2020 pbp stats lakers_pbp <- team_pbp("LAL", 2020) ## Searching team: LAL 2020 (regular season) ## Success: 21 rows obtained # Show top 10 players head(lakers_pbp, 10) %>%   select(Player, Age, G) %>%   kable()

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get statistics multiple teams /years . Total rows: 43 Teams: LAL, MIA
code: # Compare Finals teams 2020: Lakers vs Heat finals_2020 <- team_stats_bulk(   stat_function = team_per_game,   teams = c("LAL", "MIA"),   years = 2020,   season_type = "regular",   progress = FALSE ) ## Fetching data for 2 team-season combinations... ## Searching team: LAL 2020 (regular season) ## Success: 21 rows obtained ## Searching team: MIA 2020 (regular season) ## Success: 22 rows obtained ## Success: Combined 43 rows from 2 team-seasons # Show top scorers from each team finals_2020 %>%   arrange(team, desc(as.numeric(PTS))) %>%   group_by(team) %>%   slice(1:5) %>%   select(Player, team, G, PTS, AST, TRB) %>%   kable()

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Total rows: 73 Seasons: 2022, 2023, 2024
code: # Get Lakers stats for 3 consecutive years lakers_3years <- team_stats_bulk(   stat_function = team_per_game,   teams = "LAL",   years = 2022:2024,   progress = FALSE ) ## Fetching data for 3 team-season combinations... ## Searching team: LAL 2022 (regular season) ## Success: 26 rows obtained ## Searching team: LAL 2023 (regular season) ## Success: 25 rows obtained ## Searching team: LAL 2024 (regular season) ## Success: 22 rows obtained ## Success: Combined 73 rows from 3 team-seasons # Show LeBron's stats across these years lakers_3years %>%   filter(grepl("James", Player)) %>%   select(Player, season, G, PTS, AST, TRB) %>%   kable()

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Get aggregate totals across seasons franchise history. Total seasons: 83
code: # Get Warriors historical totals warriors_history <- team_stats_totals("GSW") ## Searching team aggregate stats: GSW (totals) ## Success: 83 rows obtained # Show most recent 10 seasons head(warriors_history, 10) %>%   select(Season, Lg, Tm, W, L, Age) %>%   kable()

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Filter aggregate totals specific years. Filtered seasons: 10

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: player_per_game() - Per game stats player_totals() - Season totals player_per_minute() - Per 36 minutes player_per_poss() - Per 100 possessions player_advanced() - Advanced stats player_shooting() - Shooting distance player_pbp() - Play--play player_stats_bulk() - NEW - Multiple players

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Season-Specific (8): 1. team_per_game() - Per game stats 2. team_totals() - Season totals 3. team_advanced() - Advanced stats 4. team_roster() - Roster info 5. team_per_minute() - Per 36 minutes 6. team_per_poss() - Per 100 possessions 7. team_shooting() - Shooting stats 8. team_pbp() - Play--play Historical/Aggregate (3): 9. team_stats_totals() - Historical totals (Enhanced year filter) 10. team_stats_per_game() - Historical per game (Enhanced year filter) 11. team_stats_bulk() - NEW - Multiple teams/years

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: league_per_game() - League per game averages league_totals() - League totals league_per_poss() - League per 100 poss

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: champions() - NBA championship history

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: player team functions support season_type parameter: - "regular" - Regular season (default) - "playoffs" - Postseason

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: team_stats_bulk() - Fetch multiple teams/years player_stats_bulk() - Fetch multiple players

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: team_stats_totals(team, years) - Filter historical data team_stats_per_game(team, years) - Filter historical data

title: bballref Package - Complete Function Reference
text: Reduces code repetition Automatic data combination Progress tracking Error handling Cleaner analysis workflows

title: Get NBA champions list — champions
text: Extract historical list NBA champions Basketball Reference, automatic year range validation.

title: Get NBA champions list — champions
code: champions(first_year = NULL, last_year = NULL)

title: Get NBA champions list — champions
text: first_year First year include (NULL = earliest available) last_year Last year include (NULL = latest available)

title: Get NBA champions list — champions
text: Dataframe columns: Year, Champion, team

title: Get NBA champions list — champions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # All available champions champs <- champions()  # Champions from 1980 to 2023 champs <- champions(first_year = 1980, last_year = 2023)  # Champions from 2000 to latest available champs <- champions(first_year = 2000) } # }

what: Construir URLs de Basketball Reference — construir_url_bball_ref
title: Construir URLs de Basketball Reference — construir_url_bball_ref
text: Función genérica para construir URLs de diferentes secciones de Basketball Reference

title: Construir URLs de Basketball Reference — construir_url_bball_ref
code: construir_url_bball_ref(tipo, parametros)

title: Construir URLs de Basketball Reference — construir_url_bball_ref
text: tipo Tipo de URL: "equipo_temporada", "jugador", "temporada_stats", "playoffs" parametros Lista con parámetros necesarios según el tipo

title: Construir URLs de Basketball Reference — construir_url_bball_ref
text: String con la URL completa

title: Construir URLs de Basketball Reference — construir_url_bball_ref
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ url <- construir_url_bball_ref("equipo_temporada", list(codigo = "LAL", year = 2020)) } # }

what: Extraer tabla de HTML (visible o comentada) — extraer_tabla_de_html
title: Extraer tabla de HTML (visible o comentada) — extraer_tabla_de_html
text: Extrae una tabla específica de una página HTML de Basketball Reference. Maneja tanto tablas visibles como tablas comentadas (ocultas en el código HTML).

title: Extraer tabla de HTML (visible o comentada) — extraer_tabla_de_html
code: extraer_tabla_de_html(url, id_tabla, verbose = TRUE)

title: Extraer tabla de HTML (visible o comentada) — extraer_tabla_de_html
text: url URL completa de la página id_tabla ID exacto de la tabla HTML extraer verbose TRUE, prints extraction progress messages (default: TRUE)

title: Extraer tabla de HTML (visible o comentada) — extraer_tabla_de_html
text: Dataframe con los datos de la tabla, o NULL si se encuentra

title: Extraer tabla de HTML (visible o comentada) — extraer_tabla_de_html
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ url <- "https://www.basketball-reference.com/teams/LAL/2020.html" roster <- extraer_tabla_de_html(url, "roster") totals <- extraer_tabla_de_html(url, "totals_stats") } # }

what: Find player ID by name (internal function) — find_player_id
title: Find player ID by name (internal function) — find_player_id
text: Search player's ID Basketball Reference using name. Returns player_id needed functions. Handles accents special characters automatically.

title: Find player ID by name (internal function) — find_player_id
code: find_player_id(   player_name,   return_all = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   return_name = FALSE )

title: Find player ID by name (internal function) — find_player_id
text: player_name Player's name (first /last name, case accent insensitive) return_all TRUE, returns matches. FALSE (default), returns first match verbose TRUE, prints search progress messages. FALSE, runs silently (default: TRUE) return_name TRUE, returns list player_id player_name. FALSE (default), returns player_id

title: Find player ID by name (internal function) — find_player_id
text: Character vector player_id(s), list player_id player_name, NULL match found

title: Find player ID by name (internal function) — find_player_id
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Find LeBron James find_player_id("LeBron James") find_player_id("lebron james")  # Case insensitive find_player_id("james lebron")  # Order doesn't matter  # Works with accents find_player_id("Nikola Jokic")  # Works with or without ć find_player_id("Nikola Jokić")  # Both work  # Find all players named "James" find_player_id("James", return_all = TRUE)  # Get both ID and name find_player_id("LeBron James", return_name = TRUE) } # }

what: Get player statistics for multiple players — player_stats_bulk
title: Get player statistics for multiple players — player_stats_bulk
text: Extract career statistics multiple players . Combines results single dataframe easy comparison.

title: Get player statistics for multiple players — player_stats_bulk
code: player_stats_bulk(   stat_function,   players,   season_type = "regular",   progress = TRUE )

title: Get player statistics for multiple players — player_stats_bulk
text: stat_function player stat function use (e.g., player_per_game, player_totals) players Character vector player names IDs (e.g., c("LeBron James", "Michael Jordan")) season_type Season type: "regular" regular season, "playoffs" postseason (default: "regular") progress Show progress bar (default: TRUE)

title: Get player statistics for multiple players — player_stats_bulk
text: Dataframe combined career stats players

title: Get player statistics for multiple players — player_stats_bulk
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Compare multiple players' careers goats <- player_stats_bulk(   player_per_game,   c("LeBron James", "Michael Jordan", "Kobe Bryant") )  # Compare playoff performances playoff_stars <- player_stats_bulk(   player_advanced,   c("Stephen Curry", "Kevin Durant", "Giannis Antetokounmpo"),   season_type = "playoffs" ) } # }

what: Get team statistics for multiple teams and/or years — team_stats_bulk
title: Get team statistics for multiple teams and/or years — team_stats_bulk
text: Extract team statistics multiple teams /years . Combines results single dataframe.

title: Get team statistics for multiple teams and/or years — team_stats_bulk
code: team_stats_bulk(   stat_function,   teams,   years,   season_type = "regular",   progress = TRUE )

title: Get team statistics for multiple teams and/or years — team_stats_bulk
text: stat_function team stat function use (e.g., team_per_game, team_totals) teams Character vector team codes (e.g., c("LAL", "BOS", "GSW")) years Numeric vector years (e.g., 2020:2024 c(2020, 2022, 2024)) season_type Season type: "regular" regular season, "playoffs" postseason (default: "regular") progress Show progress bar (default: TRUE)

title: Get team statistics for multiple teams and/or years — team_stats_bulk
text: Dataframe combined results teams/years

title: Get team statistics for multiple teams and/or years — team_stats_bulk
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Multiple teams, same year finals_2020 <- team_stats_bulk(team_per_game, c("LAL", "MIA"), 2020)  # One team, multiple years lakers_history <- team_stats_bulk(team_per_game, "LAL", 2018:2024)  # Multiple teams, multiple years contenders <- team_stats_bulk(team_totals, c("LAL", "BOS", "GSW"), 2022:2024) } # }

title: Get team aggregate per game stats across all seasons — team_stats_per_game
text: team_code 3-letter team code (e.g., "LAL", "BOS", "ATL") years Numeric vector years filter (optional). NULL, returns seasons. Can range (e.g., 2015:2024) specific years (e.g., c(2020, 2022, 2024))

title: Get team aggregate per game stats across all seasons — team_stats_per_game

title: Get team aggregate per game stats across all seasons — team_stats_per_game

title: Testing New Bulk Functions

what: 1. Team Stats Bulk - Multiple Teams, Same Year
title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Get per game stats Lakers Heat 2020 (NBA Finals matchup): Summary: Total rows: 43 Teams: LAL, MIA
code: finals_2020 <- team_stats_bulk(   stat_function = team_per_game,   teams = c("LAL", "MIA"),   years = 2020,   season_type = "regular",   progress = FALSE ) ## Fetching data for 2 team-season combinations... ## Searching team: LAL 2020 (regular season) ## Success: 21 rows obtained ## Searching team: MIA 2020 (regular season) ## Success: 22 rows obtained ## Success: Combined 43 rows from 2 team-seasons # Show first rows head(finals_2020, 10) %>%   select(Player, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, team) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

what: 2. Team Stats Bulk - One Team, Multiple Years
title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Get Lakers per game stats 2022 2024: Summary: Total rows: 73 Seasons: 2022, 2023, 2024
code: lakers_history <- team_stats_bulk(   stat_function = team_per_game,   teams = "LAL",   years = 2022:2024,   progress = FALSE ) ## Fetching data for 3 team-season combinations... ## Searching team: LAL 2022 (regular season) ## Success: 26 rows obtained ## Searching team: LAL 2023 (regular season) ## Success: 25 rows obtained ## Searching team: LAL 2024 (regular season) ## Success: 22 rows obtained ## Success: Combined 73 rows from 3 team-seasons # Show first rows head(lakers_history, 12) %>%   select(Player, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, season) %>%   kable() ## Error in `select()`: ## ! Can't select columns that don't exist. ## ✖ Column `Tm` doesn't exist.

what: 3. Player Stats Bulk - Compare Multiple Players
title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Compare career per game stats LeBron James Stephen Curry: Summary: Total rows: 40 Players: LeBron seasons: 0 Curry seasons: 0
code: stars <- player_stats_bulk(   stat_function = player_per_game,   players = c("LeBron James", "Stephen Curry"),   season_type = "regular",   progress = FALSE ) ## Fetching data for 2 players... ## Searching player: LeBron James ## Success: 23 rows obtained ## Searching player: Stephen Curry ## Success: 17 rows obtained ## Success: Combined 40 rows from 2 players # Show first 5 seasons for each player stars %>%   group_by(player_name) %>%   slice(1:5) %>%   select(Season, Age, Tm, G, PTS, AST, TRB, player_name) %>%   kable() ## Error in `group_by()`: ## ! Must group by variables found in `.data`. ## ✖ Column `player_name` is not found.

what: 4. Team Aggregate Stats - Filtered by Years
title: Testing New Bulk Functions
code: lakers_recent <- team_stats_totals("LAL", years = 2015:2024) ## Searching team aggregate stats: LAL (totals) ## Filtered to years: 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 ## Success: 10 rows obtained # Show all rows lakers_recent %>%   select(Season, Lg, Tm, W, L, Age, team) %>%   kable()

what: 5. Team Aggregate Stats Per Game - Specific Years
title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Get Celtics aggregate per game stats selected years: Summary: Total rows: 4 Seasons: 2023-24, 2019-20, 2009-10, 2007-08
code: celtics_selected <- team_stats_per_game("BOS", years = c(2008, 2010, 2020, 2024)) ## Searching team aggregate stats: BOS (per game) ## Filtered to years: 2008, 2010, 2020, 2024 ## Success: 4 rows obtained # Show all rows celtics_selected %>%   select(Season, Lg, Tm, W, L, Age, team) %>%   kable()

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Get Warriors aggregate totals (year filter) - showing first 10 rows: Summary: Total rows: 83 Earliest season: 1946-47 Latest season: 2025-26
code: warriors_all <- team_stats_totals("GSW") ## Searching team aggregate stats: GSW (totals) ## Success: 83 rows obtained # Show first 10 rows head(warriors_all, 10) %>%   select(Season, Lg, Tm, W, L, Age, team) %>%   kable()

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Fetch data multiple teams /multiple years: Features: - Works team stat function - Combines results single dataframe - Optional progress messages - Automatic error handling
code: # Multiple teams, same year team_stats_bulk(team_per_game, c("LAL", "BOS"), 2024)  # One team, multiple years team_stats_bulk(team_totals, "LAL", 2020:2024)  # Multiple teams and years team_stats_bulk(team_advanced, c("LAL", "BOS"), 2022:2024)

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: Fetch career data multiple players: Features: - Works player stat function - Combines results easy comparison - Accepts player names IDs - Optional progress messages
code: # Compare multiple players player_stats_bulk(   player_per_game,   c("LeBron James", "Michael Jordan", "Kobe Bryant") )  # Playoff comparison player_stats_bulk(   player_advanced,   c("Stephen Curry", "Kevin Durant"),   season_type = "playoffs" )

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
text: team_stats_totals() team_stats_per_game() now accept years parameter: Features: - Filter historical data specific seasons - Accepts ranges individual years - Maintains original functionality years = NULL
code: # All seasons (default) team_stats_totals("LAL")  # Specific range team_stats_totals("LAL", years = 2015:2024)  # Selected years team_stats_per_game("BOS", years = c(2008, 2010, 2020))

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
code: finals_matchup <- team_stats_bulk(   team_per_game,   teams = c("LAL", "MIA"),   years = 2020 )

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
code: warriors_dynasty <- team_stats_bulk(   team_advanced,   teams = "GSW",   years = 2015:2019 )

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
code: goats <- player_stats_bulk(   player_per_game,   players = c("LeBron James", "Michael Jordan") )

title: Testing New Bulk Functions
code: lakers_championships <- team_stats_totals(   "LAL",   years = c(2000, 2001, 2002, 2009, 2010, 2020) )
